file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 34-61-01-04 - FMS (HONEYWELL) COMPUTER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FMS (HONEYWELL) COMPUTER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH FMS HONEYWELL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install FMS computer 1 and/or 2. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH FMS 34-61-01-000-801-A FMS COMPUTER - REMOVAL HONEYWELL AIRCRAFT WITH FMS 34-61-01-400-801-A FMS COMPUTER - INSTALLATION HONEYWELL EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 34-61-01 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-61-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH FMS HONEYWELL 2. FMS COMPUTER - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the FMS computer 1 and/or 2. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL S.B.145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 113 113CZ Forward electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task At the forward electronic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) For aircraft PRE-MOD S.B.145-32-0036, make sure that the pressure in hydraulic system 1 is fully released ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (2) For aircraft POST-MOD S.B.145-32-0036, install safety pin of the NLG door solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (3) Open access door 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-61-01 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) (Aircraft with single FMS) On the circuit breaker panel, open the CMPTR (Location tip: DC BUS 1/NAV/CMPTR) circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (5) (Aircraft with dual FMS) On the circuit breaker panel, open the FMC1 (Location tip: DC BUS 1/NAV/FMC1) and/or FMC2 (Location tip: DC BUS 2/NAV/FMC2) circuit breaker(s) and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it (them). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Release the knurled nut (3) which attaches the FMS computer (1). (2) Pull the FMS computer (1) by its handle, until it is disconnected from the electrical connector (2) attached to the mounting rack. (3) Remove the FMS computer (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-61-01 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH FMS HONEYWELL FMS Computer - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 213 1 B B 2 DET. A 1. FMS COMPUTER 3. KNURLED NUT 2. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR DET. B 1 AIRCRAFT WITH SINGLE FMS. 2 AIRCRAFT WITH DUAL FMS. 145AMM340158.MCE B EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-61-01 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-61-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH FMS HONEYWELL 3. FMS COMPUTER - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the FMS computer 1 and/or 2. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-04/100 - SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-61-00-470-802-A/200 FMS - MODE CONFIGURATION FLIGHT MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (FMS) - OPERA- AMM TASK 34-61-00-700-801-A/500 TIONAL TEST S.B.145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 113 113CZ Forward electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task At the forward electronic compartment I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the FMS computer (1) on the mounting rack. (2) Push the FMS computer (1) by its handle, until it is connected to the electrical connector (2) attached to the mounting rack. (3) Tighten the knurled nut (3) which attaches the FMS computer (1) to the mounting rack. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 34-61-01 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) (Aircraft with single FMS) On the circuit breaker panel, close the FMS (Location tip: DC BUS 1/NAV/CMPTR) circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it. (2) (Aircraft with dual FMS) On the circuit breaker panel, close the FMC1 (Location tip: DC BUS 1/NAV/FMC1) and/or FMC2 (Location tip: DC BUS 2/NAV/FMC2) circuit breaker(s) and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it (them). (3) (Applicable to aircraft equipped with EGPWS) Make sure that the FMS is configured to operate in the pattern mode ( AMM TASK 34-61-00-470-802-A/200). (4) Do the FMS Operational Test ( AMM TASK 34-61-00-700-801-A/500). (5) Close access door 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-04/100). (6) On aircraft POST-MOD S.B.145-32-0036, remove the safety pin of the NLG door solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 34-61-01 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
